title: Gus Poyet keen to bring Chelsea's John Terry to China
title_page: Gus Poyet keen to bring Chelsea's John Terry to China | Daily Mail Online
text:
Gus Poyet believes the chance to bring John Terry to the Chinese Super League this summer is a 'great opportunity'.
The Chelsea captain will leave Stamford Bridge when his contract expires at the end of the season but he has confirmed his intention to play on elsewhere.
A number of Premier League sides are interested in Terry, but Shanghai Shenhua boss Poyet is keen to be reunited with his former team-mate in the Far East.
John Terry will leave Chelsea at the end of the season after 22 years with the club
Terry gets instructions from Antonio Conte before being sent on against Southampton
The pair played alongside each other briefly at Chelsea as Terry was breaking into the first-team before Poyet moved to Tottenham in 2001.
And the former Sunderland and Brighton manager believes the 36-year-old still has plenty to offer despite his age.
'It is a great opportunity for him and for all the teams here [in China], including us,' Poyet told talkSPORT.
'The latest change of the quantity of foreigners on the pitch stops some clubs from bringing in defenders, but we are talking about a special one.
'It is a great possibility that China will be one of the possible situations for John Terry in the future.'
Terry could leave Chelsea with five Premier League titles to his name after coming off the bench to help Antonio Conte's men beat Southampton 4-2 on Tuesday night.
Shanghai Shenhua manager Gus Poyet is hoping to be reunited with Terry in China
Poyet and Terry challenge for a header during an FA Cup game against Peterborough in 2001
Poyet added: 'He has had a great career.
'He is going to be remembered forever. He is a great captain and he has done everything for the club.
'It is a very difficult decision whether to stay in England or go abroad. I would like him not to play in the Premier League for another club - maybe I'm a little bit selfish!'
